X Factor, but he confirms there will be one familiar face on the panel- himself. "Once the show goes into production, I become a judge," Simon Cowell told reporters Monday. Then I have to put my trust into the producers' hands, which is effectively how it works in the U.K. Yes, I am judging. Before the show starts, Simon Cowell will serve as executive producer and participate in the selection of the judging panel, which has been widely speculated about. I could do this, there would be no point in making the show." The mentoring component grew out of him becoming bored and frustrated just sitting at the Idol desk and picking apart performances. I wanted to make a show on which I and my fellow judges could help on a weekly basis. It's interesting to be judged as much as the artists. It really does become incredibly competitive. Unlike the singers, we don't pretend to like each other. Simon Cowell avoided commenting extensively on the new Idol judges panel, saying he hasn't seen a whole episode.
